title: 112_hr6659
content: The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" is cited as the short title. It extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds by treating them as qualified bonds issued before January 1, 2011. It increases the applicable percentage for such bonds and includes interest in gross income. An economic development extension bond is defined as a specified bond issued within a 1-year period for qualified purposes. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds by treating them as qualified bonds issued before January 1, 2011. It defines a specified bond as any obligation (other than a private activity bond) with excludable interest under section 103. Qualified purposes include any qualified economic development purpose. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds to specified cities with high unemployment rates and population loss between 2000 and 2010. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" limits the maximum aggregate face amount of bonds designated for specified cities based on population proportions. The Secretary allocates bond limitations to cities based on their population in relation to the total population of all specified cities. Extension of recovery zone economic development bonds for certain cities, effective for obligations issued after the enactment of this Act.
